function: Fetches all dynamic data from backend APIs to populate map, comparison features, and dashboard charts.
static_description: The frontend displays an interactive map centered on neighborhoods with ivory background (#FFFFF0) and forest green (#228B22) UI components. It includes sections for area selection, data comparisons, and customizable dashboards.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking on a neighborhood highlights it and fetches demographic, economic, and crime data via respective API endpoints.
Users can drag chart widgets within the dashboard to rearrange their layout positions.

resource_dependency.neighborhoodSchemaDefinition: Table: neighborhoods(id UUID PRIMARY KEY, name TEXT, boundary GEOMETRY(POLYGON), created_at TIMESTAMP); Table: demographics(neighborhood_id UUID REFERENCES neighborhoods(id), population INTEGER, median_age FLOAT, household_income FLOAT, year INTEGER); Table: economics(neighborhood_id UUID REFERENCES neighborhoods(id), employment_rate FLOAT, businesses_count INTEGER, average_rent FLOAT, year INTEGER); Table: crimes(neighborhood_id UUID REFERENCES neighborhoods(id), total_incidents INTEGER, violent_crimes INTEGER, property_crimes INTEGER, year INTEGER);

function: Connects to PostgreSQL database using predefined environment variables and manages structured storage of neighborhood data across multiple categories.
static_description: Backend server establishes connection to PostgreSQL instance using provided credentials and initializes tables for storing neighborhood boundaries, demographic statistics, economic indicators, and crime records.

resource_dependency.neighborhoodBoundaryLayerSource: GeoJSON formatted neighborhood boundaries served from /api/map/boundaries endpoint

function: Displays neighborhood boundaries visually on an interactive map allowing users to select areas for further analysis.
static_description: An interactive map fills most of the viewport showing outlined neighborhood regions over an ivory background with forest green controls such as zoom buttons and layer toggles.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking inside a neighborhood polygon selects that region, changes its fill color temporarily, and triggers data fetching for demographic, economic, and crime metrics.
Mouse hovering over a neighborhood shows a tooltip displaying its name without changing state or triggering API calls.

function: Enables side-by-side comparison of selected neighborhoods across demographic, economic, and crime data points.
static_description: Comparison view presents two or more selected neighborhoods horizontally aligned with tabs for switching between data types (demographics, economics, crime). Icons represent each category against a clean ivory backdrop with forest green headers.

interaction_and_states.description: Selecting a new neighborhood adds it to the comparison grid. Clicking existing selections removes them. Tab clicks switch displayed data type.

function: Provides interactive visualizations in the form of charts grouped under a user-configurable dashboard interface.
static_description: Dashboard consists of draggable/resizable chart cards arranged in a responsive grid layout. Charts show bar graphs, line plots, or pie charts representing various datasets related to selected neighborhoods. Background is ivory with forest green card headers.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking chart titles toggles expanded view mode.
Dragging chart headers repositions them within the grid.

resource_dependency.layoutPersistenceMechanism: localStorage or backend user preferences store

function: Allows users to personalize how dashboard elements are positioned and saved between sessions.
static_description: Dashboard provides layout customization tools including resize handles and position anchors on each widget. Users see save/reset layout options beneath the main grid panel.

interaction_and_states.description: Widgets can be moved freely around the canvas while maintaining alignment constraints.
Save button persists current arrangement to local storage or user profile. Reset button restores default configuration.

function: Applies consistent styling throughout the application using specified ivory and forest green colors.
static_description: Entire app uses ivory (#FFFFF0) for backgrounds and forest green (#228B22) for active components like buttons, headers, and selected items. Typography and spacing follow modern accessibility standards.

interaction_and_states.description: Buttons and links slightly darken when hovered to indicate interactivity while preserving base theme palette.

resource_dependency.responseFormat: { id: string, population: number, medianAge: number, householdIncome: number, year: number }

function: Exposes RESTful GET endpoint to retrieve demographic information associated with specific neighborhood identifiers.
static_description: Endpoint returns JSON-formatted demographic data upon request, including population count, age distribution, income levels, and time period.

resource_dependency.responseFormat: { id: string, employmentRate: float, businessCount: integer, avgRent: float, year: number }

function: Provides access to economic indicators tied to individual neighborhoods through a dedicated API route.
static_description: Returns structured economic data such as job rates, business density, and rental costs per location requested.

resource_dependency.responseFormat: { id: string, totalIncidents: integer, violentCrimes: integer, propertyCrimes: integer, year: number }

function: Delivers crime-related statistical data for queried neighborhood IDs via HTTP GET requests.
static_description: Responds with aggregated incident counts categorized into violent vs. property crimes along with temporal metadata.

resource_dependency.mapSelectionHandlerCode: JavaScript handler listening to click events on map polygons

function: Integrates map selection logic enabling users to highlight chosen areas dynamically during exploration.
static_description: Upon clicking a neighborhood shape, the system applies a distinct visual style indicating selection status without altering underlying geometry.

interaction_and_states.description: Polygon receives highlighted border and semi-transparent overlay matching forest green theme when clicked.

function: Renders graphical representations of numerical data sets within dashboard panels.
static_description: Each chart occupies a modular container presenting either bar graphs, line trends, or pie slices depending on dataset nature. Visuals match ivory background with forest green accents.

interaction_and_states.description: Hovering over chart segments reveals tooltips containing precise numeric values.

function: Ensures usability and proper rendering across desktop and tablet screen sizes.
static_description: Application adapts fluidly to smaller viewports by stacking content vertically, resizing fonts proportionally, and optimizing touch targets accordingly.

resource_dependency.packageJsonStructure: {"scripts": {"install:all": "concurrently \"cd client && npm install\" \"cd server && npm install\"", "dev": "concurrently \"cd client && npm run dev\" \"cd server && npm run dev\""}}
resource_dependency.projectDirectoryLayout: Root contains package.json; client/ folder holds frontend code; server/ folder contains backend code

function: Defines NPM commands to streamline installation and development workflows for full-stack team collaboration.
static_description: Root-level package.json includes custom scripts named 'install:all' which runs parallel installs in both frontend and backend directories, and 'dev' which launches both environments simultaneously.

resource_dependency.sqlMigrationFiles: CREATE TABLE neighborhoods(...); CREATE TABLE demographics(...); etc.
resource_dependency.relationshipConstraints: Foreign keys linking stats tables back to neighborhoods.id column

function: Establishes relational database structure capable of persisting complex geographic and statistical information efficiently.
static_description: PostgreSQL database initialized with normalized schema comprising four interconnected tables modeling spatial units alongside their evolving demographic, economic, and criminal attributes.
